name: Frame Of Reference (Omey Salvi)
description:
A puzzle game based on the forced perspective mechanic that was first created by Albert Shih in The Museum of Simulation Technology, which eventually turned into Superliminal.

Story:

You wake up inside a computer simulation with no memory of your past. A computer voice talks to you and gives you instructions. She tells you that you were found in a coma. The simulation is designed to revive you.

Who are you? How did you get here? Can you survive the simulation? What is this machine that is trying to revive you? Why is it trying to revive you?

All you know is that you have to place the blocks on the correct pad to get to the next simulation.

Playtime ~ 1 hour.

Notes: I'm the original developer of Frame of Reference. The game was released on Steam and then transferred to another publisher. I bought the rights back and the game is now available for free. There are no changes from the Steam version except for some visual bug fixes. I did refactor the code a little. I tested the final build but please let me know if any bugs slipped through.
